caption.p: 10.1186/s40064-016-2699-y A questionnaire to determine the level of awareness of climate change markers was divided into two broad sections, namely: (1) Household characteristics and (2) Awareness of climate change markers. The 1st section addressed age, gender, education level, marital status, main livelihood and sources of food while the second section addressed the changes observed in different climate change markers (temperature, rainfall, drought, floods, water availability and prevalence of malaria) over the last 20 years.
